Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: View or edit how to print your IRS 1099 form statement

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: View or edit the instructions for the printed version of the 1099 form document.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Enable using 1099 forms to transmit the tax data to the IRS in the United States. This guide helps you set up the reporting periods, forms, form boxes and statement for Dynamics 365 Business Central. If you do not want to set this up right now, close this page.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Welcome to the setup of IRS Forms

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the year for which you will be reporting the tax data to the IRS. This is applicable for both options below.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether you want to create the new setup automatically instead of doing it manually - a reporting period, forms, form boxes and a statement.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether you want to transfer the data from the IRS 1099 Base Application to the new IRS forms extension. This includes IRS 1099 form boxes, vendor setup, purchase documents and vendor ledger entries.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the reason why the data transfer is not possible.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Create new setup, or transfer existing data

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: If you’re setting up Business Central, choose Create New Setup. Business Central will create the forms and associated setup so you can fill out and print them. If you’re upgrading and already have data for your 1099 form, choose Transfer Existing Data. Both options require you to specify the reporting year for the tax data to the IRS. The data creation or the transfer process starts when you finish the guide.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the task should be run in the current or in the background session.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the earliest date and time when the task should be run in the background session.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the task should be run immediately in the background session.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the user does understand the update procedure and agree to proceed.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies if the mapping between the IRS 1099 Form Line and associated vendor ledger entries must be kept. That will allow you to drill-down into the Amount field, but requires an extra space in the database.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies if the TIN of the vendor/company must be protected when printing reports.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Specify the features of the IRS Forms

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Specify how the IRS Forms feature will be used in your company.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: You're ready to use the IRS Forms functionality! Open the IRS Reporting Periods to access the setup and documents.

Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: The IRS Forms setup is completed!

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Here you can set up all the forms and form boxes you want to report in the certain period. Form boxes will be used in the documents.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the setup for vendors to be reported in this period.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Here you can set up mapping between vendors and forms for reporting in the certain period. When you create a document for a certain vendor, the system will use this setup to fill in the form boxes.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the adjustment amount for vendors and form boxes in this period

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Here you specify the adjustment amount for vendors and form boxes. The adjustment amount will be added to the calculated amount in the form box when you create a form document.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the documents to be reported in this period.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Here you can create the form documents based on the vendor ledger entries with form boxes and adjustments. The documents will be used for reporting to the IRS.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Copy the setup from another period. That includes forms with boxes, vendor setup, adjustments and form statement.

Properties.Name: AboutText
Properties.Value: Here you can set up the different periods and form boxes, vendor mapping, and statement for reporting per period.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the period to create a form document for

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the vendor to create a form document for. If this field is empty then forms will be created for all vendors.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the form to create a form document for. If this field is empty then forms will be created for all forms.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies whether the newly created forms will replace the existing ones. If this option is not selected then only new forms will be created and the existing ones remain the same.

Properties.Name: ToolTip

Properties.Name: ToolTip
